author: Special Correspondent
text:
Civil society organisations and human rights groups of the Puducherry have urged the Union Territory Government to consider premature release of life-convicts who completed 10 years.

In 1999 and 2003, the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) issued guidelines to States and Union Territories for premature release of life convicts.

Guidelines by

NHRC

Following guidelines issued by NHRC, Tamil Nadu, Kerala and Karnataka frequently have been releasing prisoners.

They welcomed the move of the Puducherry Government to release 18 life-convicts who had completed 14 years in prison in the recent period.

TN releasing prisoners

G. Sugumaran, secretary of Federation for People’s Rights said, “The Tamil Nadu government has been releasing prisoners who completed 10 years in prison.

The Puducherry Government should also consider to release the convicts who had completed ten years in the prison.
